moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nf6 3. Nf3 Be6 4. c5 c6 5: after 10 moves is clear that my opponent has only one plan:  put pressure on my king side ignoring any other ideas ..like develop pieces , coordination etc. ....just push pawns hoping in one my mistake
moves.10... Qa5 11. Qc2 Bf5 12. Bd3 h5 13. h3: regarding my plans , I  show here my very flexible position able to conter attack on king side and at same time developping pieces in a logical way with enough coordination
moves.14... h4 15. Bh2 Bg6 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. B: looking the position now is clear my stronger strategy and tactical situation:for example black bishop is completely trapped by his own pieces while mine is in a powerful active position controlling the h2-b8 diagonal, my knight according to the pawn structure is ready to be an active piece on the Queen side (as the pawn structure indicate, white should attack on queen side and black on king side )
moves.22... b5 23. cxb6 e.p. Nxb6 24. Nd2 a5 2: as you can see black instead of open the position helping his passive pieces (king and bishop) to come into the fight, he decided to start his attack on " my " side of the board I mean the queen side, but as logical understanding and as you easily can see, I have more pieces and a stronger strategy on that side
now the key moment , when he decided to accept the Queen exchange, determining his helpless end game
moves.35. Qxb5 cxb5 36. Kd3 Ra4 37. Kc3 Kf7 38: and now with this simple  d5+  I'm sure to bring my c5 pawn to promotion with an easy with his bishop still trapped into his pawns....since move 12!!!!   he substantially plaied almost all the match with 1 piece less because of his weak strategy based only on " pushing pawns " without any real plan
moves.43... Kxd5 44. Kxb5 e5 45. c6 Kd6 46. Kb: now he loses even his bishop (just out of his jail).......the rest is story........don't undervalue ideas and plans in chess....strategy
